Booked Out podcast

Booked Out is our monthly book recommendation podcast, from Woodbridge Libraryâ€™s Kellie Dimmock, Richard Baker, Sheila Haskins and Sophie Green.

October 2016: Reading habits

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Oct 31, 2016

Sheila and guests discuss reading habits: Where we read, when we read, what we read and why?

September 2016: Sci-Fi and Fantasy

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Oct 8, 2016

Richard and guests Clare and Guy discuss Laputa - Castle in the Sky, Dir. Hayo Miyazuki, Porco Rosso Dir. Hayo Miyazuki, Atomised by Michel Houellebecq and The Galactic Pot Healer by Philip K Dick.

August 2016: Children's Fiction

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Aug 22, 2016

Sophie and guests discuss titles from this year's Carnegie Award shortlist for outstanding children's and YA fiction, plus other recommendations for younger readers including; Itch by Simon Mayo, The Book Thief by Marcus Zusack, The Hunger Games by Suzanne Collins, the Tom Gates series by Liz Pichon, and picture books by Steve Anthony, Kate Baker and Hui Skipp, and David Melling.

July 2016: Box sets and DVDs - anything but Game of Thrones

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jul 25, 2016

Among the DVD box sets discussed this month are The Thick of It, Girls, Flowers and Orange is the New Black.

June 2016: Brave New Reads

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jun 28, 2016

Sophie and guests discuss the six titles chosen as the Brave New Reads for 2016: Signs Preceding the End of the World by Yuri Herrera, Spill Simmer Falter Wither by Sara Baume, The Secret to Not Drowning by Collette Snowden, The Illusion of Separateness by Benjamin van Booy, Just Mercy by Bryan Stevenson and The Last Pilot by Benjamin Johncock.

May 2016: Diaries and Journals

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2016

Kellie and guests discuss favourite diaries and journals including A Notable Woman: the Romantic Journals of Jean Lucey Pratt, The Motorcycle Diaries by Ernesto, Che Guevara, The Natural History of Selbourne by Gilbert White, Notes from Walnut Tree Farm by Roger Deakin and Buster's Diaries by Roy Hattersley.

April 2016: Classic horror

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2016

Richard and guests discuss classic horror titles including Lost Hearts by M R James, Mary Shelley's Frankenstein, Edgar Allan Poe's The Tell-Tale Heart and The Golem by Gustav Meyrink.

March 2016: Local authors, local heroes

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Mar 1, 2016

Sheila and guests discuss their favourite local authors including Ruth Dugdall and Delia Smith and featuring special guest star, author Robin Herne.

February 2016: Under the radar

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Feb 1, 2016

Sophie and guests discuss recommended titles in international fiction including: Neverhome by Laird Hunt; A Heart so White by Javier Marias; Don't Let's Go to the Dogs Tonight by Alexandra Fuller; Novel 11, Book 18 by Dag Solstad and Snow by Orhan Pamuk.

January 2016: Books that have made a difference

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jan 1, 2016

Kellie and guests discuss titles that have changed their lives including; Threads: the Delicate Life of John Craske by Julia Blackburn, No Surrender by Constance Maud, Nella Last's War: the second World War Diaries of housewife 49 by Nella Last ,and The Little Grey Men by BB.

December 2015: Best of 2015

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Dec 1, 2015

Sophie and guests discuss the most borrowed titles of 2015 plus some recommendations from library staff and customers including The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins, Go Set a Watchman by Harper Lee, H is for Hawk by Helen Macdonald and Save with Jamie by Jamie Oliver.

November 2015: Judging books by their covers

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Nov 1, 2015

Sheila and guests discuss how, why and whether or not we should be judging books by their covers. Titles discussed include Northanger Abbey by Val McDermid, The Betrayers by David Bezmozgis and Little Failure by Gary Shteyngart.

October 2015: Noir

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Oct 1, 2015

Sophie and guests discuss Noir in print, film and television titles available from Suffolk Libraries including Deep Water by Patricia Highsmith, The Spirit by Will Eisner, True Detective, Chinatown, L.A. Confidential, The Killing, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo by Steig Larsson and Frank Miller's Sin City.

September 2015: The natural world

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Sep 1, 2015

Kellie and guests discuss best recommended Natural History books including Badgerlands by Patrick Barkham, Meadowland: the private life of an English field by John Lewis-Stempel, Wildlings: The Secret Garden of Eileen Soper, My First Summer in the Sierra by John Muir, Wild Places by Robert Macfarlane, Last Chance to See by Douglas Adams and Mark Carwardine, and Humble by Nature by Kate Humble.

August 2015: Best of children's fiction

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Aug 1, 2015

Sophie and guests recommend children and YA fiction titles for all ages including Buffalo Soldier by Tanya Landman, Swallows and Amazons by Arthur Ransome, Wonder by R.J. Palacio, Looking for Alaska by John Green, picture books by Emma Chichester Clark and Rebecca Cobb, and series including Erin Hunter's Warrior Cats, Adventure Island by Helen Moss, iHorror (Pick your path) by Steve Barlow and Steve Skidmore, and the Naruto Manga by Masahai Kishimoto.

July 2015: Books in translation

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jul 1, 2015

Richard and guests discuss recommended titles of translated fiction including Miss Smilla's Feeling for Snow by Peter Hoeg, The letter for the King by Tonke Dragt, Out Stealing Horses by Per Petterson, The Dead Lake by Hamid Ismailov, and The Ghost Rider by Ismail Kadare.

June 2015: Brave New Reads

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jun 1, 2015

Sophie Green and guests discuss the six titles selected as Brave New Reads for 2015: The Dead Lake by Hamid Ismailov, Fallen Land by Patrick Flanery, Black Country by Liz Berry, Any Other Mouth by Anneliese Mackintosh, Badgerlands by Patrick Barkham and Prayers for the Stolen by Jennifer Clements.

May 2015: Cookery books

Written by the Booked Out team · Published May 1, 2015

Kellie and guests discuss their favourite cooks and cookery books including Sous Chef: 24 Hours in the Kitchen by Michael Gibney, Eat: The Little Book of Fast Food by Nigel Slater, Nigella Lawson's How to be a Domestic Goddess and James Martin's Great British Winter Cookbook.

April 2015: Lucky dip

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2015

In this improvised 'Lucky Dip' edition, Sheila and guests review a random selection of titles and explore the art of judging books by their covers. Books discussed include Little Women by Louisa M Alcott, Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, The Little Old Lady who Struck Lucky Again by Catharina Ingelman-Sundberg, When I was a Nipper by Alan Titchmarsh and Kenneth Grahame: An Innocent in the Wild Wood by Alison Prince.

March 2015: Irish writers

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Mar 1, 2015

Irish Writers. In celebration of St. Patrick's Day, Sophie Green and guests discuss titles by Irish Writers available through Suffolk Libraries including Amongst Women by John McGahern, History of the Rain by Niall Williams, Nora Webster by Colm Toibin and The Butcher Boy by Patrick McCabe.

February 2015: Love is in the air

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Feb 1, 2015

Love is in the Air. Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Romance in titles available through Suffolk Libraries including North and South by Elizabeth Gaskell, Uncommon Arrangements by Katie Roiphe, Love Lessons by Joan Wynham, Vivien's Heavenly Ice Cream Shop by Abby Clements and Fifty Shades of Grey by E.L. James

January 2015: Graphic novels

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jan 1, 2015

Richard Baker and guests discuss Graphic Novels available through Suffolk Libraries including DC Comics, Minutemen/Silk Spectre, Alan Moore's V for Vendetta and Watchmen and Ordinary Victories by Manu Larcenet.

December 2014: Now thatâ€™s what I callâ€¦ the best of 2014

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Dec 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests round up the year with recommendations from library staff and customers including The Unlikely Pilgrimage of Harold Fry by Rachel Joyce, The Miniaturist by Jessie Burton, Adam Fouldâ€™s In the Wolfâ€™s Mouth and River Cottage Light and Easy â€“ Healthy Recipes for Every Day by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, plus the films Gravity and Philomena.

November 2014: The best of the box sets

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Nov 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss The Killing, Mad Men, Game of Thrones and Our Zoo.

October 2014: Novellas and short fiction

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Oct 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Testament of Mary by Colm Toibin, On Chesil Beach by Ian McEwan, Will Not Attend by Adam Resnick, Hotel du Lac by Anita Brookner and The End of the Affair by Graham Greene.

September 2014: Things that go bump in the night

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Sep 1, 2014

Sheila Haskins and guests review some titles that will give you the creeps.

August 2014: The fabulous world of childrenâ€™s books

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Aug 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Fault in Our Stars by John Green, The Enemy series by Charlie Higson and The Enchanted Wood by Enid Blyton as well as the works of Oliver Jeffers, Marcus Sedgwick, Holly Webb and Patrick Ness.

July 2014: Non-fiction ands its rise in popularity

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jul 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Travels in West Africa by Mary Kingsley, Coming Up Trumps â€“ A Memoir by Jean Trumpington, Toast: The Story of a Boyâ€™s Hunger by Nigel Slater and Jane Austen by Claire Tomalin.

June 2014: Audiobooks

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jun 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss Love, Nina by Nina Stibbe, Our Man in Havana by Graham Greene and The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt.

May 2014: Stories from childhood

Written by the Booked Out team · Published May 1, 2014

Sheila Haskins and guests discuss The Little Prince by Antoine Saint-ExupÃ©ry, Destination Moon by Herge, and The Outsiders by S.E. Hinton.

April 2014: Time slip

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss Atonement by Ian McEwan, Restless by William Boyd, The Vanishing Act of Esme Lennox by Maggie Oâ€™Farrell, The Return by Victoria Hislop, Ferney by James Long, The King of Shadows by Susan Cooper and Life after Life by Kate Atkinson.

March 2014: The great detectives in literature and television

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Mar 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Georges Simenonâ€™s - Maigret, Margery Allinghamâ€™s Albert Campion, the iconic Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle and Vera by Anne Cleeves.

February 2014: Book club special

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Feb 1, 2014

Sophie Green is joined by members of the Golden Age Book Group to discuss Ray Bradburyâ€™s Fahrenheit 451.

January 2014: One step beyond

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jan 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Time Machine by H.G. Wells, The Dispossessed by Ursula Le Guin, Cloud Atlas by David Mitchell and Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? by Philip K. Dick.

December 2013: Escapism

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Dec 1, 2013

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Cellist of Sarajevo by Steven Galloway, The Knife of Never Letting Go by Patrick Ness, Instructions for a Heatwave by Maggie Oâ€™ Farrell and Walking back to Happiness by Lucy Dillion.

November 2013: Rom com in film

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Nov 1, 2013

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Mrs. Doubtfire, Groundhog Day and the Road Movies of Bob Hope and Bing Crosby.

October 2013: Poetry

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Oct 1, 2013

Sheila Haskins and guests discuss William Blakeâ€™s The Tyger, Roald Dahlâ€™s Revolting Rhymes, and A.A. Milneâ€™s Now we are Six.

September 2013: Book club special edition

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Sep 1, 2013

Sophie Green joins members of the Seckford Book Group for a discussion of Julian Barnesâ€™ A Sense of an Ending.

August 2013: Creepy house Summer Reading Challenge special

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Aug 1, 2013

Sophie Green and guests discuss include Alfie the Werewolf by Paul van Loon, The Thing by Chris Powling, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory by Roald Dahl, Jacqueline Wilson and the Harry Potter series, as well as sharing recommendations for reluctant readers.

July 2013: Young adult fiction

Written by the Booked Out team · Published Jul 1, 2013

Kellie Dimmock and guests recommend teen fiction for readers of all ages. We also review this year's Carnegie Medal short list and the winner, Sally Gardnerâ€™s Maggot Moon.
